intro: Enterosora cornuta, commonly known as the horned enterosora, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, horn-like structures on its seed pods. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical environments, preferring well-drained soils. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, and it produces small, hairy seeds enclosed in elongated, spiny pods. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
